citations.narrative:
The facility did not have acquisition records for two pigs, two rabbits and two guinea pigs that have arrived at the facility
nor were they listed on the current records of animals on hand. These records are required to be maintained in a timely
and accurate manner and made available to APHIS officials during the inspection process.
Correct by: June 25, 2023

Currently the guinea pig food is maintained in the original bag that is not sealed nor in a leak proof container. Per this
regulation food supplies must be stored in leakproof container with a tightly fitting lid to protect the food supplies against
spoilage or deterioration. This needs to be addressed for the health of the animals.
Correct by: June 25, 2023

Currently the guinea pigs are housed in a sheltered barn with no ability to cool the area down when temps go above 85
deg F. Per this regulation, guinea pigs may not be housed in outdoor facility’s unless approval is provided by the Deputy
Administrator. The animals need to be moved into an indoor facility for their health and well being.
Correct by: June 25, 2023

The current shelter for the three pigs housed outside adjacent to the barn have a shelter with a roof and one side wall that
comes down ¾ of the way to the ground. There are no sides to the shelter and this shelter does not provide effective
protection if a storm comes through in allowing the animals to stay dry. This needs to be addressed for the welfare of the
animals while out on exhibit for the summer months.
Correct by: July 1, 2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
